events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle which occurred on April 30th at a busy intersection. Initial claim filed for further processing.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords provided by the customer describing the collision with another vehicle.
An insurance claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's case and initiate the verification process for the vehicle accident.
The customer was notified that their vehicle accident claim has been officially acknowledged and that the investigation will begin shortly.
Requested the customer to provide additional documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and any witness statements.
Customer submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed photos of the damaged car and the official police accident report.
The investigation team has started reviewing the submitted documents and inspecting the circumstances of the car accident for liability assessment.
Investigation completed with findings indicating the other driver was at fault based on provided evidence and police documentation.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer for vehicle repair costs and other damages totaling a reasonable amount based on estimate reports.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely investigation and the settlement offer proposed by the insurance company.
The claim was approved after customer acceptance of the settlement proposal and verification of all submitted documents.
Insurance payment was issued to the customer's account covering the costs of vehicle repairs and associated expenses from the accident.
The claim was officially closed after payment was confirmed and no further action was requested by the customer.
All records and documentation related to the auto accident claim were archived in compliance with company policy for future reference.
